page.title: 06THE WINDMILL AT MEIR HEATH.
page.content: The Windmill was recorded on Yate's county map of 1775 and was thought to have been built by R.A.Broster in 1771.The pub by it was called The Dusty Miller.In 1827 the mill had a kiln, new built house, garden and stables.In 1939 two sails and a cap remained until the Home Guards removed them and built a watchtower for the war and that was removed in the 1960s.Now the tower carries a set of radio communication aerials.Two of the three windows have been altered from rectangular to circular.The windmill went out of use after 1897 because the machinery was worn out.Altons Brewery of Derby bought the mill and The Dusty Miller. Staffordshire Potteries Water Works bought the mill in 1908 and put in a water tank to distribute water locally and it stayed like this until 1928 when Joules Brewery bought it.
